website_summaries.verdict: A great pick for beginning hunters that offers greater penetration and reliability compared to other budget broadheads.
pros: Simple 2-blade construction with 2-inch cutting surfaces arranged in aerodynamic fashion
Cutting edges are large enough to retain a strong grip in the animal hide after a successful hit
cons: Blades can break off when retrieving the broadhead

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Head
customer_reviews.text: I shot an 8 pt with the Killzone and it is one wicked broadhead that leaves a massive entry and exit wound. The huge blood trail starting right where I shot the deer.I hunt where every shot is in the rocks, picked up the broadhead no broken blades closes right no issues. I will touch up the blade and back in the quiver for the next deer. Thumbs up to NAP for this great head I plan to use for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Huge entry and exit holes
customer_reviews.text: I've used NAP expandable broadheads for years. I love the killzone. Every deer I've shot has had a huge entry and exit hole. While any broadhead will kill a deer when the shot is perfect, the huge cutting diameter of these heads puts them down when the shot placement is less than ideal. Face it, if you bow hunt long enough, you're going to make a bad shot. This broadhead helps put meat in the freezer on those occasions.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Beauchamp

customer_reviews.title: Sure worth a try.
customer_reviews.text: Recommended to me by my bow tuner. He likes the way they fly and work. Upone apperance nothing really impressive, in fact the point is not that sharp. I took some sand paper to the head and then a stone and much better. Idk. Have not harvested anything with them but. I think they are worth a try, not terribly expensive. Nice not to have to deal with rubber bands or collar. Just load and go. Open on impact. Everything has its trade offs but I would recommend trying it and forming your own opinion. Edit. Used on a buck worked flawlessly shooting 58#
customer_reviews.author: CHRISTINE M. PRIETO

customer_reviews.title: better than any other mechanical and some fixed blade I've ...
customer_reviews.text: This broadhead represents evolved mechanical broadhead design. The built-in clip design eliminates the hassle and propensity to fail of o-ring designs, and the thick and wide blades survive contact with ribs, dirt, and rotten logs, better than any other mechanical and some fixed blade I've tried. This is the only wide blade mechanical I've been able to wash off and return to my quiver. The practice broadhead places right along side my field points. I have harvested two does with these broadheads with marginal shots. The wound channels are as advertised. highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: islandgrown

customer_reviews.title: Best Blood Trail, Massive Damage
customer_reviews.text: Can't believe the negative reviews on see on here about this broadhead. I killed two does (with my Barnett Ghost crossbow) with these broadheads and both went no more than 30 yards. The blood trail was incredible caused by a huge hole these things produce. One of the broadheads was bent afterwards but with the damage these things do and the blood trail they produce, it's a small price to pay. I usually use fixed heads but never again, these will be the only broadheads I use with my crossbow.
customer_reviews.author: Michael D.

customer_reviews.title: Flies like a field point
customer_reviews.text: Extremely happy with the accuracy of this broadhead. Switched the blades out and put the included practice piece in and shot a bullseye at 20 yards and the same accurate grouping out to 40. Shot 1 deer last season with these and the deer dropped within sight. Broadhead was in good condition and reusable. My go to head for whitetail
customer_reviews.author: ADK_MTBer

customer_reviews.title: Different color than the pictures that are displayed.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been buying these broadhead s for 10 years. I’ve never seen this color. They are not the same color as your pictures. One is not working properly. Can someone please tell me why these are a different color. The one on the left is my old one same color as they been always. The right one is the new one totally different color. I hope they ain’t knock offs. When your taking an animals life you don’t want bootlegs. Can someone please explain.
customer_reviews.author: Justincase

customer_reviews.title: Almost an unfair advantage.
customer_reviews.text: WOW!!! I have always used fixed blades and vowed to never trust a mechanical! This blade changed my mind in a HUGE way!! After tracking far too many deer, after a good shot with a fixed blade, I switched over to these. I am a bowhunter that is sponsored by a fixed blade company, and I STILL use these and always will!! You will never track another deer!!
customer_reviews.author: Donald Alan

customer_reviews.title: Fast & Humane
customer_reviews.text: I had less than ideal shot placement, but still dropped my buck in 20-yards. It’s a fast and humane broadhead with large entry/exit wounds. I’ll definitely be using them again.
customer_reviews.author: Oasky

customer_reviews.title: Awesome broadhead
customer_reviews.text: I just shot my first deer with this broadhead and it worked perfectly. Perfect accuracy and the damage was amazing. The entrance wound is huge. The blood trail was bigger than when I shoot one with a 12ga shotgun. The practice blade insert did not fit properly (Like others have complained about). I filed a very small amount of material off it and it worked fine. This is a minor issue and I am okay with it after shooting a deer with this broadhead!
customer_reviews.author: J.M.

customer_reviews.title: Best on the market !
customer_reviews.text: These things are wicked ! Best I have used , I shoot them from a ten point cross bow and they are always accurate . I shot 4 deer this season all with the kill zone . I used the same head twice. I will say the cut on contact heads do bend if it hits bone . The chisel tip are the best . All had pass through and 2 inch or better exit wounds . The furthest any of the 4 deer ran was 40 yards .
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Deadly!
customer_reviews.text: These are factory recommended for my Ten Point Turbo GT crossbow. First hunt downed 5 point buck from 18yds. Only ran 40 yards before piling up. Snow on ground. Massive blood loss. Entrance and exit holes huge! Can't wait for October to repeat the process!
customer_reviews.author: richard  k

customer_reviews.title: Great Broadhead
customer_reviews.text: Great broadhead! Used them for 5 years and many deer. Never had a failure or problem with them.
customer_reviews.author: Greggy

customer_reviews.title: Deadly accurate
customer_reviews.text: 2 deer in 2 days with 2 shots: 42 and 45 yards. Both on the mark, straight pass throughs and Taratino-like blood trails. Both broadheads still usable. I have used several different broad heads and these are my new favorite.
customer_reviews.author: A. Harkness

customer_reviews.title: Reliable
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with performance. I have taken 8 deer with these heads and all were short track jobs.
customer_reviews.author: momof2

customer_reviews.title: Mediocre performance compared to others
customer_reviews.text: I've killed a few deer with this broadhead but this year I hit a deer broadside in the ribcage at 8 yards and got absolutely no penetration (maybe 4") and no blood trail. After having killed a couple with them where they performed very well, I was very disappointed with this outcome.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler R. Cortright

customer_reviews.title: New Archery Products Killzone 100 gr.
customer_reviews.text: Very nice tips that fit well on my Easton arrows (bolts). Unfortunately I have a cross bow and these are not recommended for cross bows. Great customer service on sending back the product.
customer_reviews.author: oldcat

customer_reviews.title: NOT for a CROSSBOW
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my crossbow because I found them on a site that listed them as one of the 10 best broadheads for crossbow. However, when I received them it says right on the back of the package "Do not use with a crossbow" or anything over 350 fps. I gave them to my son who use a compound bow.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Heinritz

customer_reviews.title: ... yourself a favor and try these they leave an awesome blood trail
customer_reviews.text: Do yourself a favor and try these they leave an awesome blood trail!
customer_reviews.author: kevan e.

customer_reviews.title: big cutt on impact
customer_reviews.text: love these 2 inch cut big blood trails, have not lost a deer yet im sold on thses
customer_reviews.author: Rvhuds

customer_reviews.title: Fly great and work perfectly ....every time
customer_reviews.text: I used NAP KZ’s for a few years then I bounced around with fixed and competitive mechanicals. Now I’m back to KZ’s and will never change. Accurate, massive cut, always deploy, no rings or bands, never deflect of ribs. Perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Has worked very well for me.
customer_reviews.text: I've had great luck with these so far. I've have not lost an animal yet, all good quick clean hits. I would certainly use these again.
customer_reviews.author: john p

customer_reviews.title: Accurate and reliable.
customer_reviews.text: Amazingly accurate, I can switch from field point to these broadheads without making any sight adjustments. I used them for an archery antelope hunt in Montana this year. Worked perfectly even at 67 yards.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Broadhead
customer_reviews.text: Great broadhead. Performed very well. Found downed deer within 40 yards. Blades stay very tight so you need to work them open and closed alot to break them in.
customer_reviews.author: dustin

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: My favorite expandable. Massive exit AND entrance wound. Shoots straight as a field point.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: Machining looks to be off, would not buy again.
customer_reviews.text: Practice tip will not fit inside of slot for the blades, only came with 1 wrench......not impressed
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Worked great as expected
customer_reviews.text: Worked great as expected. Passed right through a doe at 30 yards and left a massive cut. Only down side is there is no practice head but you do get practice blades you can change out.
customer_reviews.author: Vincent Voorhees

customer_reviews.title: Great broadhead. They fly similar to practice points and ...
customer_reviews.text: Great broadhead. They fly similar to practice points and and they plough a huge 2" hole through your target. Took a doe last week and she walked about 200' and laid down.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas J. Venditto

customer_reviews.title: Deer slayer
customer_reviews.text: No blood trail needed only run 30 40 yards with well placed shot
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Deadly
customer_reviews.text: These broad heads are deadly! Huge entry and exit wounds produce quick and clean kills which is important to true sportsmen!
customer_reviews.author: James K Caviness

customer_reviews.title: 10 deer never ran over 100 yards with good blood trails
customer_reviews.text: Full pass through stuck into the ground and still sharp enough to shave with
customer_reviews.author: trent

customer_reviews.title: They are accurate and awesome kill power
customer_reviews.text: I've dropped 3 deer with these this past hunting season. They don't go far!!
customer_reviews.author: Brian Mountain

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Did the job and don't have to worry about collars.
customer_reviews.author: Alexis Kraley

customer_reviews.title: Two of my broad heads were in great functioning condition
customer_reviews.text: Two of my broad heads were in great functioning condition. I am very dissatisfied on the third broad head because the blades could not fold back and the screw would not tighten (the blades were very loose and dysfunctional).
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Awesome broad head and great price
customer_reviews.text: Awesome broad head and great price. Shot through the shoulder of a deer and you couldn't even tell the broad head had been shot.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle H.

customer_reviews.title: Sold
customer_reviews.text: Fly spot on with my field points. Arrowed an eight pointer this season. He made it 40 yds tops.
customer_reviews.author: Adam K

customer_reviews.title: DID NOT COME WITH PRACTICE HEAD but they are still great tips
customer_reviews.text: DID NOT COME WITH PRACTICE HEAD, but I have used these on deer and turkey and they are great. Would have given a fifth star if they just put the practice head in like it says on the ad and package. I shoot 58# Hoyt Charger and have never had an issue with deployment. Killed two turkeys and two deer with them and recovery was a breeze.
customer_reviews.author: c

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: first time using this type of broad head ,,big mature doe ..complete pass thru...big entrance and exit hole...
customer_reviews.author: olin hewitt

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Great
customer_reviews.text: I recently switched to these mechanicals as I wanted a broadhead that would fly as much like a field point as possible. Well they do, they are super accurate, the blades won't deploy prematurely as with some other designs, and they are very durable. I harvested a doe 9 days into this season with a quartering away shot, penetration with Easton axis arrow was awesome, entry wound was huge, blades deployed fully and even cut through bone, she was down within 8 to 10 seconds. These things really boosted my confidence, I know for certain where my arrow is going to impact and that's what we all owe to the game we pursue.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Gering

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: No box sent, alll broadheads www loose not sure I trust the authenticity
customer_reviews.author: Nebraska hunter

customer_reviews.title: Not for me
customer_reviews.text: These broadheads make a huge wound but if they hit any bone and they are wrecked. Lots of money to spend for one shot. I would not buy these again.
customer_reviews.author: Flyman41

customer_reviews.title: Stick with Fixed Blades
customer_reviews.text: First time in my life that I have not gotten a broadside pass-through. I'm back to thunderheads after a disappointing hunt with these. 16 years and 29 deer is just too good of a record to trust to a mechanical
customer_reviews.author: Herbie

product_meta.title: NAP Killzone Mechancial Broadhead 100 Grain Two Blade 2" Cutting Diameter Trophy Tip 3 Pack
product_meta.description: Nap NAP-60-997 Killzone 100 2" Trophy Tip (3 Pack)
feature_bullets: Trophy tip for extreme cutting and penetration
Spring Clip design - no 0-rings or rubber bands

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
